intro: Oreopanax steinbachianus, commonly known as the Steinbach's sarsaparilla, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a climbing shrub characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically divided into several narrow, pointed leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Oreopanax steinbachianus thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
